alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 11:33AM EST until December 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County, Coastal Wakulla County, and Coastal Jefferson County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Thursday to 7 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Water levels will rise to 1.5 to 2.5 feet mean higher high water around the time of high tide. These water levels will result in minor flooding in Apalachicola near the boat ramp and also along Water Street. Minor overwash is possible at Alligator Point Road. Minor flooding along the waterfront is also expected at Mashes Sands Beach, Panacea, and Saint Marks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will be highest around the time of high tide, which is around 130 am ET Friday morning. The threat for coastal flooding will end by daybreak Friday as winds shift offshore.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Wakulla
